problem:
Let $a,$ $b,$ $c$ be the roots of $x^3 + px + q = 0.$  Express
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix}\]in terms of $p$ and $q.$
solution:
We can expand the determinant as follows:
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} &= (1 + a) \begin{vmatrix} 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} - \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} + \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 + b \\ 1 & 1 \end{vmatrix} \\
&= (1 + a)((1 + b)(1 + c) - 1) - ((1)(1 + c) - 1) + (1 - (1 + b)) \\
&= abc + ab + ac + bc.
\end{align*}By Vieta's formulas, $ab + ac + bc = p$ and $abc = -q,$ so
\[abc + ab + ac + bc = \boxed{p - q}.\]
model_solution:
To evaluate the determinant, we expand it along the first row:

\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} = (1 + a)\begin{vmatrix} 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} - \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} + \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 + b \\ 1 & 1 \end{vmatrix}.\]

Now, let's calculate each of the $2\times 2$ determinants separately.

First, we have:

\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} = (1 + b)(1 + c) - 1.\]

Then,

\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} = 1(1 + c) - 1 = c.\]

Finally,

\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 + b \\ 1 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = 1(1) - (1 + b) = -b.\]

Now, substitute these values back into the expanded expression for the $3\times 3$ determinant:

\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} = (1 + a)((1 + b)(1 + c) - 1) - c - b.\]

We can simplify this expression to get:

\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} = (1 + a)(1 + b + c + bc) - 1 - c - b.\]

This simplifies to

\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} = 1(1 + b + c + bc) + a(1 + b + c + bc) - 1 - c - b.\]

\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} = (1 + a + b + c + bc + ab + ac) - (1 + c + b).\]

\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} = a + b + c + bc + ab + ac.\]

Since $a, b, c$ are the roots of $x^3 + px + q = 0$, by Vieta's formulas, we know that:

$a + b + c = 0$, 
$ab + bc + ac = p$, and
$abc = -q.$

We can then substitute these expressions into the previous expression for the determinant:

\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} = 0 + 0 + p - q.\]

Finally, simplifying this expression gives us the final answer:

\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix} = \boxed{p - q.}\]
